communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAPD Incident Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting incident reports from the following traffic collisions involving LAPD officers. The officer's names and incident reports must include by law:
"information that must be made available to the general public includes: the time, substance, and location of the complaints or request for assistance; the time and nature of law enforcement’s response; the time, date, and location of occurrence; the time and date of the report; factual circumstances surrounding the crime or incident; a general description of injuries, property and/or weapons involved; and the name and/or age of the victim (unless their identity must remain confidential under state law). 

- Dashcams, body cams, and any audio/video collected by your department related to these incidents must be included. 

The law: "Disclosure may be delayed for up to one year during an active criminal or administrative investigation, but only if the disclosure would substantially interfere with that investigation. 

Agencies must be able to produce audio or visual recordings while maintaining a reasonable expectation of privacy for those being depicted in the recording. Agencies are expected to use redaction technology that blurs or distorts images or audio. If an agency cannot adequately protect a subject’s privacy with the use of such redaction technology, then it may withhold the entire recording. However, a copy must be made available to any person (or designated representative) whose privacy interest is protected by the public nondisclosure."

I am aware this is a significant request. Please provide the reports to us in rolling production. I appreciate your assistance in advance and understand it may take time to fully release the records. 

The names of those involved in the corresponding settlements are below. Council files are available, too. 
Shah, Nadira v. City of Los Angeles, et al.	L20-00261   	19STCV16095

Mr Scott,

Our apologies for the delay on this latest request. it appears it was
conflated with a similar request that was processed for you recently. We
will begin to search for records immediately. We will have a determination
for you on or before January 17, 2025.

Thank you for your patience and understanding,
Frank Mateljan

On Dec. 30, 2024:
Subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAPD Incident Reports
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the
following records:

Hello,

I am requesting incident reports from the following traffic collisions
involving LAPD officers. The officer's names and incident reports must
include by law:
"information that must be made available to the general public includes:
the time, substance, and location of the complaints or request for
assistance; the time and nature of law enforcement’s response; the time,
date, and location of occurrence; the time and date of the report; factual
circumstances surrounding the crime or incident; a general description of
injuries, property and/or weapons involved; and the name and/or age of the
victim (unless their identity must remain confidential under state law).

- Dashcams, body cams, and any audio/video collected by your department
related to these incidents must be included.

The law: "Disclosure may be delayed for up to one year during an active
criminal or administrative investigation, but only if the disclosure would
substantially interfere with that investigation.

Agencies must be able to produce audio or visual recordings while
maintaining a reasonable expectation of privacy for those being depicted in
the recording. Agencies are expected to use redaction technology that blurs
or distorts images or audio. If an agency cannot adequately protect a
subject’s privacy with the use of such redaction technology, then it may
withhold the entire recording. However, a copy must be made available to
any person (or designated representative) whose privacy interest is
protected by the public nondisclosure."

I am aware this is a significant request. Please provide the reports to us
in rolling production. I appreciate your assistance in advance and
understand it may take time to fully release the records.

The names of those involved in the corresponding settlements are below.
Council files are available, too.

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all requests or applications for qualified contracts for LIHTC developments submitted to the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority, including the following:

1) The year of the application or request
2) The projects's name, full address, and ownership
3) The qualified contract price
4) The total number of units covered
5) The outcome of the request and start and end dates of the deregulation period, if one ensued
6) Any information retained by the agency on the requester or applicant, including their name, contact information, and organizational affiliation

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P135274-040724
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records held by the King County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on April 07, 2024 and given the reference number P135274-040724 for tracking purposes. 
 
Within five (5) business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All job-related manuals regarding KC DAJD correctional officer policies and procedures
- Blank copies of all department forms or templates currently used by KC DAJD correctional officers

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: General Records Request :: G009117-070924
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
We are in receipt of your public records request, received on 7/9/2024, and are responding to it on behalf of the King County Executive Branch only per King County Code 2.12.005 and 2.12.230(B). Your request has been assigned tracking number G009117-070924. 
 
We are reviewing your request and will respond within five business days with a first installment date, responsive records, clarification, or closure of this request. 
 
Sincerely, 
King County Executive Branch 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXS6wXctu3kN4CE40dfY-2F8GzW4hcrKo-2BtJXty7ZDhXMAy0WtOAEr-2FeaZxsOtzScfUApFh3Z-2BnJVrgGXSp86nVbcw-3DcOSR_e7Rf05mJTy7Qtx-2BBPjZ9MbrhPFEGqZ01DyHrE3iYVGy-2Bdw9WS8hJTAkOOZWI7wKdffX1GDMgvr-2BBACXxsnQgk-2FKQcs85rrgBcj9mFMc163IDphTaSxwQ5q8-2BGnBJjH0kPSqw-2BB-2BBSj9gAQJk0j294Z7Uz4-2BNa4oNNfqOmWRcml1lPqCcHlCnC51ZtFkidBxaxzyl7SP2OVQgCYpcnOHkEaWFVG2TqSbVCtA9leb4XFWbUeVPk-2F8DMfNxNtWM3B-2BPAwAbgVhKq2ryWbFk755ug6PyI9keaGfudWkHY-2FQ0zkXR-2BP8pqzrS3SfLNQ1IVQztWsWjJ3ZO-2F-2FkfgS1VTSTM8uulEcxVtUWqT7z-2FBGIGRwRFaI1llG3FiWkfqJf2-2BlwXxkcw9bFHA7QFliEU8rlQXA-3D-3D)

communications.subject: Public Records Request Center - General Records Request :: G009117-070924
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
July 16, 2024 Re: G009117-070924 Dear Rose Terse I am writing to you regarding your request, G009117-070924, for: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- All job-related manuals regarding KC DAJD correctional officer policies and procedures 
- Blank copies of all department forms or templates currently used by KC DAJD correctional officers 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse" This appears to be a duplicate request to G009099. As this is a duplicate to a previous request, I am going to close this request. Additionally, G009099 was originally assigned to a coworker, however, I will be taking over that request as of today. In summary, this is a duplicate to a previous request and will be closed, and I will keep the previous request open and respond under that one. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709  To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXS6wXctu3kN4CE40dfY-2F8GzW4hcrKo-2BtJXty7ZDhXMAy0b80MxsLUy2Oq0hy9sP192nnToLCeDNW0vTrCO2ExAV-2BNN2X-2BJDdx7GEnRQvNcjjHBrVqvu-2Bc-2B7Mog5X8joZrw-3D-3D4rfe_e7Rf05mJTy7Qtx-2BBPjZ9MbrhPFEGqZ01DyHrE3iYVGy-2Bdw9WS8hJTAkOOZWI7wKdffX1GDMgvr-2BBACXxsnQgkwwu751eVqHNKl7Y4YDmVLP-2BARwlTrCQAvT3K6cF6Kw3JT5OwUC7h40OB7p25TSj8e0eJFQ8l1fMRQBm7ZE0uwZddLSmkhg3gmpCBq1zRGhniWP6qq9bBYD8YVtU8L0JlVRQJauVxztkkPcjy6mnk8Ficq9OoWTaSoV20GkShJhqUB9RUzJJvmeg59aTl6dpdYWRArCoY5qSjx-2BDK0evT0Y3D-2FEHWf0PvNrlD7hA1JFpdx0XNwI0oK7RFSKaSyDMNefA-2B7Dk2VOUATyzZ2jZ-2FImS8CWoL3LLjwyWXtQ6bLePE56dvCGCRpzmT-2BQIFgg-2BBA-3D-3D)

communications.subject: Public Records Request Center - General Records Request :: G009099-070824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello, 
I am providing you with an update on this request. I am taking this request over from my coworker, Michael. Additionally, I closed G009117 as a duplicate to this request. 
I am in the process of locating and obtaining any blank copies of any identifiable forms used by the department. 
I do need clarification on the first part of your request. Do you require only the policies and procedures for the Department? When you say you want all manuals, what do you mean by manuals? Do you mean something in addition to the policies and procedures? If so, can you describe what you are looking for? 

I want to ensure I am providing you with the records you are seeking. 
I still plan to have an installment to you on, or before, 8/2/2024, as previously scheduled with Michael. 
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. 
Thank you, 
Jeremiah Schuetze 
Public Records Coordinator - DAJD  To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXS6wXctu3kN4CE40dfY-2F8GzW4hcrKo-2BtJXty7ZDhXMAy0b80MxsLUy2Oq0hy9sP196UK7f82vQ-2FejI4-2BqSyjgqlHBreRRpnhcpS8Oxs3P0Lzd3qcp4jyv-2Fh4obdz6LLuvg-3D-3DApSH_e7Rf05mJTy7Qtx-2BBPjZ9MbrhPFEGqZ01DyHrE3iYVGy-2Bdw9WS8hJTAkOOZWI7wKdffX1GDMgvr-2BBACXxsnQgk6CJvuiVkBZZmsVTjFqyRLOak3Q3J6QxYDdCyVoPVaWBy0-2FvrqhwCHbFLhJvYsibR286JjJWgpk86guTuoRBJCPtAQf-2FgJ9MWse6YH6qgnT3NTTY8Sn5IhGm1m0P5E7XTU1H7jShhO8V-2BB-2FYkPLseNf9t4yMiz9JGr46YtfWFYYO-2Ffgl7tSCFyKGQnaNgXJ67d4bjypMfTKCryFo-2FxwG7UM2yGMhDgc7uOutg6boQH9RAzJouLKS49d926dN9HqycDLM2tcCk3RsFlOCYdOgMIIbF-2FFleJav7oedYgDic6OLqBxSJvzPn7Ovqh0E-2FR4wJw-3D-3D)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #G009117-070924
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on April 7, 2024. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Aug. 2, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #G009117-070924.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Public Records Request Center - General Records Request :: G009117-070924
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello, 
Thank you for your message on 8/1/2024. This request, identified by tracking number G009117 was closed as a duplicate to G009099. 
G009099 has an installment due today, however, it will not be closed for quite some time as this request is quite large. 
As for your clarification regarding looking for "any documents regarding department policies and procedures for all DAJD job titles." Many positions at DAJD do not have a specific policy/procedure manual for them. I will address this in my installment to you later today under G009099. 
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. 
Thank you, 
Jeremiah Schuetze 
Public Records Coordinator - DAJD 
206.263.3709

communications.subject: Public Records Request Center - General Records Request :: G009099-070824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
August 02, 2024 Re: G009099-070824 Dear Rose Terse Thank you again for the public records request which the King County Executive Branch received from you on July 08, 2024.  We understand you are seeking the following records: "Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- All job-related manuals regarding KC DAJD correctional officer policies and procedures 
- Blank copies of all department forms or templates currently used by KC DAJD correctional officers 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." The first installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Public Records Request Center. Click the link below to retrieve the records.  Please note that the link works best with the Google Chrome browser, and any pop-up blockers need to be turned off. General Records Request - G009099-070824 This installment contains an index of all DAJD forms and an index of the Adult Division Policies and a Department wide index of policies (this one may include policies for Juvenile and Administration divisions). Per my message to you earlier today, under G009117, we do not have policies tied directly to the Corrections Officer positions, rather policies that may or may not be utilized by Corrections Officers. The same goes for forms, as there are over 1200 forms listed in the index and many of them may be used by Corrections Officers, but are not specifically for only Corrections Officers. If you could read through the indexes I have provided to you and get back with me on which Forms and policies you may want, I can begin to process them. If I hear back from you soon, I can have an installment ready for you by 8/14/2024. If I do not hear back from you by 8/14/2024, I will send another email asking for clarification on exactly which forms and policies you need. Please contact me if you have any questions. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709

communications.subject: Public Records Request Center - General Records Request :: G009099-070824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello, 
Thank you for your message on 8/11/2024, advising you wanted all of the Policies listed in the policy index I provided to you, and that you will advise me on which forms you require at a later date. 
I had originally scheduled an installment for 8/14/2024, however, I was out of the office the last couple of days and did not have access to my files. As such, I have rescheduled the installment for Monday 8/19/2024. 
For the policies, I will provide the policies in order starting with Chapter 1 and proceeding through until I have released all of them. Some of the installments with policies will be larger than others, as some policies will require redactions and some will not. 
If you can provide me with the list of forms at your earliest convenience, I can begin gathering them as well. 
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. 
Thank you, 
Jeremiah Schuetze 
Public Records Coordinator - DAJD 
206.263.3709

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." The 3rd installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Public Records Request Center. Click the link below to retrieve the records.  Please note that the link works best with the Google Chrome browser, and any pop-up blockers need to be turned off. General Records Request - G009099-070824  This installment contains policies responsive to your request. Please refer to the document titled, "exemption key" for details on any redactions that may have been applied to this installment. I have scheduled the next installment for 10/8/2024. Per RCW 42.56.120(4), WAC 44-14-04006(1) and KCC 2.12.250(H), the King County Executive Branch can close a records request as abandoned after 30 days if a requestor does not inspect, view, download or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requestor. Please contact me if you have any questions. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709

December 12, 2024 Re: G009099-070824 Dear Rose Terse, Thank you again for the public records request which the King County Executive Branch received from you on July 08, 2024.  We understand you are seeking the following records: "Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- All job-related manuals regarding KC DAJD correctional officer policies and procedures 
- Blank copies of all department forms or templates currently used by KC DAJD correctional officers 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." The latest (8th) installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Public Records Request Center. Click the link below to retrieve the records within 30 days. General Records Request - G009099-070824 This installment contains DAJD Policies responsive to your request. Please refer to the document titled, "exemption key" for details on any redactions that may have been applied. This link works best with the Google Chrome browser, and pop-up blockers need to be turned off. Per RCW 42.56.120(4), WAC 44-14-04006(1) and KCC 2.12.250(H), the King County Executive Branch can close a records request as abandoned if a requestor does not inspect, view, download, or pick up the entire set of records or one or more of the installments within 30 days of its release. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requestor. I have scheduled the next installment for 12/30/2024. Please contact me if you have any questions. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709

January 09, 2025 Re: G009099-070824 Dear Rose Terse, Thank you again for the public records request which the King County Executive Branch received from you on July 08, 2024.  We understand you are seeking the following records: "Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- All job-related manuals regarding KC DAJD correctional officer policies and procedures 
- Blank copies of all department forms or templates currently used by KC DAJD correctional officers 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." The latest (10th) installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Public Records Request Center. Click the link below to retrieve the records within 30 days. General Records Request - G009099-070824  This installment contains the last of the policies for the Department. Please refer to the document titled, "exemption key" for details on any redactions that may have been applied. I am withholding the post orders for specific CO positions, per exemption code "C2" on the exemption key. These documents are withheld as they contains very specific information and procedures that if they were released would truly have safety and security impacts. Additionally, I have not received notice from you regarding which of the forms, if any, you required copies of. Please provide this information as soon as you are able, so I can begin processing the remainder of your request. This link works best with the Google Chrome browser, and pop-up blockers need to be turned off. Per RCW 42.56.120(4), WAC 44-14-04006(1) and KCC 2.12.250(H), the King County Executive Branch can close a records request as abandoned if a requestor does not inspect, view, download, or pick up the entire set of records or one or more of the installments within 30 days of its release. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requestor. I have scheduled the next installment for 2/6/2025. However, if I am not advised of which forms you require, I will not be able to proceed with this request. Please contact me if you have any questions. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709  To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello, 
Thank you for your message advising I do not need to provide any further forms templates. 
I have provided you with a copy of the policies for DAJD, but I cannot remember if we discussed post orders. Do you require copies of the post orders? I will advise that much of the post orders would be redacted for security concerns (RCW 42.56.420(2) as they contain emergency response plans, and detail specific duties/tasks/times that if published would lead to possible security and safety issues). However, they do detail the policies that apply to those specific posts, which I have already provided to you. 
If you do require the post orders, I can provide an installment in a few weeks. If you do not require the post orders, I can close this request. Please let me know as soon as you can, and I will work to provide an installment on 2/20/2025. 
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. 
Thank you, 
Jeremiah Schuetze 
Public Records Coordinator - DAJD 
206.263.3709

February 20, 2025 Re: G009099-070824 Dear Rose Terse As I have not heard back from you about whether you need copies of the Post Orders (heavily redacted as I mentioned on 2/6/2025), and your message to me on 2/6/2025 advising you had all you needed for now, I am closing this request. However, I can re-open it if you need me to. The records responsive to your request are available to you now in the Public Records Request Center. Click the link below to retrieve the records. Please note that the link works best with the Google Chrome browser, and any pop-up blockers need to be turned off. General Records Request - G009099-070824  Your request is now closed because records were provided to you. In accordance with Cousins v. DOC, No. 101769-3 (2024), we do not intend to further address your request, therefore, the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review of our response to your request has started to run. Please feel free to contact me within 30 days if you have any questions about your request, if you believe responsive records have not been provided, or if you need assistance accessing the records. Sincerely, Jeremiah Schuetze Public Records Coordinator 206.263.3709  To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center.

title: PLPCO Comms lawsuit (Department Of Natural Resources)

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: PLPCO Comms lawsuit (Department Of Natural Resources)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written or electronic communications sent or receive by PLPCO Director/ DNR Deputy Director Redge Johnson that contain one or more of the following words or phrases: "Stand for our Land", or otherwise refer to the recent litigation that Utah filed against the federal government to gain control of more than 18 million acres of BLM land. You can read more about that lawsuit here: https://standforourland.utah.gov/?utm_source=Master%20Press%20List%202.0&utm_campaign=593ad11544-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2024_08_20_05_07&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_-593ad11544-%5BLIST_EMAIL_ID%5D

I am a reporter for The Guardian and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (February 2025) (Kittitas County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R009104-020125
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
 The Kittitas County Prosecuting Attorney's Office received a public records request from you on February 01, 2025. You requested: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fkittitas-county-prosecuting-attorney-35225%252Fbrady-list-february-2025-kittitas-county-prosecuting-attorney-180772%252F%253Femail%253Dprosecutor%252540co.kittitas.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAGleo7StUZuCJlmYkVrqjLZ9IU%3A1teRfK%3AFaAFbYl5YYtsFuxyFs1gLGDypoH2tLRv8Wi9rCJgWzA" A Public Records Officer of the Prosecuting Attorney's Office will be helping you with your records request. An initial search and review of records matching your request will be completed and reply will be posted within five (5) business days.  This reply will either provide the requested records, ask you for clarification of your request, provide an estimate of fees, or, if your request is broad and involves a large number of records, you’ll be provided a schedule of response installments. Please note, the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request in the Kittitas County Public Records Portal.  For your convenience, we are providing links to the legal authority which determines our response to public records requests: 
 
  *  Public Records Act, Chapter RCW 42.56 Kittitas County Codes Chapter 2.55 Thank you for your interest in public records. Sincerely, Prosecuting Attorney's Office 
Kittitas County, WA

Christine Rice 
Civil Legal Assistant

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Salaries (2002-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a complete list of all police department employees for the years 2002-2022, including employee name, department, job title, hire date, base salary and/or hourly wage as applicable, bonus compensation (where applicable), overtime wages (where applicable), and total compensation.

I am aware of the salary information posted at https://data.seattle.gov, however it is not responsive to this request because it does not include hire date, base pay, bonuses, overtime, or total compensation information.

Please do not transfer my request to another department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

  * You can download your document by clicking on it. 
  *  Please save your document as you may only download it from the system three times. If you do not download your document within 30 days of request closure, the link to your document will expire.

Sincerely, 
Seattle Human Resources 
Elena

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C155375-100823
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C155375-100823 received on October 08, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV23-C155375-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C155375-100823. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-C155375-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

The records being made available to you at this time include the following: Installment 1 2012-2016. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C155375-100823. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have not prepared a detailed exemption log, as only limited information has been redacted from the responsive records. The information normally provided in an exemption log, such as title, author, recipient, subject, and number of pages, is readily ascertainable from looking at the redacted records. Redactions have been applied throughout the documents pursuant to the following exemption: 
The redacted information reflects personally identifying information regarding an employee who has either provided a sworn statement (as described in RCW 42.56.250(1)(i)) and had the information verified by the employing department or provided proof of participation or participation of a dependent in the address confidentiality program under RCW 40.24. 
Due to the size and scope of your request, we are providing records to you in installments. We anticipate that the next installment of records will be available on or about 04/02/2024. 
Sincerely, 
Seattle Human Resources 
Elena

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Please provide a complete list of all police department employees for the years 2002-2022, including employee name, department, job title, hire date, base salary and/or hourly wage as applicable, bonus compensation (where applicable), overtime wages (where applicable), and total compensation. 

I am aware of the salary information posted at https://data.seattle.gov, however it is not responsive to this request because it does not include hire date, base pay, bonuses, overtime, or total compensation information. 

Please do not transfer my request to another department. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse

Your new estimated due date is 10/17/2024.

I am aware of the salary information posted at https://data.seattle.gov, however it is not responsive to this request because it does not include hire date, base pay, bonuses, overtime, or total compensation information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-human-resources-28607%252Fpolice-salaries-2002-2022-152944%252F%253Femail%253Dshr_info%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAEV8frB-K1jbK8dEdMQiu2OyJU%3A1qphDz%3ADyMTtkr68Xtr-BZslFvw8SQjiMUqBQzxzu9CWDpjqQA The records being made available to you at this time include the following: Installment 3. 2017, 2021 - SPD payroll data 2000-2003 - SPD payroll data. Please note, we were only able to obtain total earnings for this period due to the fact that this is  an older data. To download your records, please: 
 
  *  
 Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  *  
 Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  *  
 Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  *  
 Select this request: C155375-100823. 
  *  
 Select the 'View Files' button. 
  *  
 You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  
 Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. 
  *  
 If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.  We have not prepared a detailed exemption log, as only limited information has been redacted from the responsive records. The information normally provided in an exemption log, such as title, author, recipient, subject, and number of pages, is readily ascertainable from looking at the redacted records. Redactions have been applied throughout the documents pursuant to the following exemption: 1. RCW 42.56.250(1)(i).  Public employees who, either themselves or their dependents, are enrolled in the Address Confidentiality Program or are survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault or sexual abuse, stalking, or harassment. The following information is exempt from public disclosure: employee's name or personally identifiable information, such as job title, addresses of work stations and locations, work e-mail address, work phone number, or bargaining unit, maintained by a public employer in personnel-related records or systems. 2. Investigative Information - RCW 42.56.240(1), RCW 42.56.050 - Record includes information non-disclosure of which is essential to effective law enforcement. (RCW 42.56.240(1) as defined by RCW 42.56.050) Explanation:  Disclosure would jeopardize a criminal investigation/prosecution. 
Due to the size and scope of your request, we are providing records to you in installments. We anticipate that the next installment of records will be available on or about 01/28/2025. Sincerely, Elena Azhgirei Public Disclosure Officer Seattle Human Resources

Dear Rose Terse, 
We received a response from the vendor stating they do not collect and are unable to provide a report on date filled and job requirements fields. 
This notification completes our response to your public disclosure request C155375-100823. We have provided all responsive records. 
The Human Resources Department considers your request closed and plans to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Elena Azhgirei 
Public Disclosure Officer 
Seattle Human Resources
